intro: Alsine maroccana, commonly known as Moroccan sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and hairy. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Alsine maroccana is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
